definition: two-faced, three knives (idiom); double-cross/double dealing and back stabbing
two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
variant of 麵|面[mian4]
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc
surname San
three/3
knife/blade/single-edged sword/cutlass/CL:把[ba3]/(slang) dollar (loanword)/classifier for sets of one hundred sheets (of paper)/classifier for knife cuts or stabs
surname Dao

sentences.english: Tom's friend said he was a double-tongued liar.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆的朋友说他是个两面三刀的骗子。

sentences.english: I'm beginning to learn how two faced you are.
sentences.chinese: 我开始了解你是怎样一个两面三刀的人。

sentences.english: So, Barack Obama is two-timing us Brits again.
sentences.chinese: 所以，奥巴马再一次两面三刀了。
我不喜欢两面三刀的人。

sentences.english: But he has no sisters. He is a two-faced person.
sentences.chinese: 可他没有姐妹，这个两面三刀的人。

sentences.english: He that is neither one thing nor the other has no friends.
sentences.chinese: 这故事是说那些两面三刀的人，最终不会有好下场。

definition: lit. honeyed words, a sword in the belly (idiom); fig. hypocritical and murderous
lit. see the wind and set the helm (idiom); fig. to act pragmatically/to be flexible and take advantage of the situation
outside appearance and inner reality differ (idiom); not what it seems/saying one thing but meaning sth different
two-faced person/double-dealing
to incite a quarrel (idiom); to sow discord between people/to tell tales/to make mischief
lit. a dagger hidden in smiles (idiom); friendly manners belying hypocritical intentions/when the fox preaches, look to the geese
treacherous and murderous
to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power/social climbing
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
hypocrite
snob
hypocrisy/pretended righteousness
lit. to destroy the bridge after crossing the river (idiom)/fig. to abandon one's benefactor upon achieving one's goal
breaking faith and abandoning right (idiom); to betray/treachery/perfidy
to harbor evil intentions (idiom); concealing malice
heart and mouth at variance (idiom); keeping one's real intentions to oneself/saying one thing but meaning sth different
